column1: Since COVID-19 hit nearly 30% of Vermonters have experienced food insecurity.   The CARES Act played a big role in helping feed the hungry—but the hunger relief programs expire next month. We must pass another COVID-19 relief package NOW.

Sending encouragement to all Vermonters as we battle COVID-19 during the holiday season.  I know it’s isolating to be apart from friends & family right now. But we will get through this together—just like we did at the start of this pandemic. Stay strong!

A huge thank you to the food security advocates at @HungerFreeVT.  The CARES Act was critical to hunger relief during COVID-19 but that’s set to expire next month. We urgently need another stimulus package.  https://t.co/YGBmlizvOO

While uncertainty continues to brew here’s one thing I know:   House Democrats are doing everything we can to get COVID-19 relief to American individuals families & small businesses who need help right now.   https://t.co/7r8vaApKBM

Big thank you to @gracepotter for joining me in support of #SaveOurStages!  Too many independent venues have shut down since COVID-19 struck. This bill provides an economic lifeline to them—with most funds going right back to our community members.   https://t.co/PoMBsVX8HG

I’m pleased to see the President-elect make controlling COVID-19 an immediate priority & to lead with science in doing so.  A robust public health response—one that looks out for all Americans—will save countless lives and defeat this pandemic for good.  https://t.co/NAFAMq9ReW

✅@MondaireJones a progressive champ whose 1st priority is COVID-19 relief for millions of struggling Americans. He makes history as our 1st LGBTQ+ Black Congress member!   ✅Marie4Congress who isn’t afraid to stand up to powerful interests to help working people. (3/5)

Any Dave Matthews fans around here? 🤚  This weekend Peter will be watching him + other inspiring artists play at the virtual #SOSFest in support of #SaveOurStages.  It’s critical that our local music venues get the support they need during COVID-19.  https://t.co/6QInyH8GEK

VT’s Covid response has been outstanding. Vermonters have stepped up and been vigilant and thoughtful throughout the pandemic.  We’ve all taken precautions for our community our neighbors our loved ones. Don't stop now. Keep up the good work VT!   https://t.co/FrwmJ4iw9H

Big thanks to Jack Hedges and all of our front line providers in VT who have administered nearly 170k COVID-19 tests. Jack gave Peter a COVID-19 test at the end of last week which came back negative after he (safely) traveled to DC.   Vermonters stay safe and wear a mask! https://t.co/icqpbPfSul

Americans need relief NOW in the wake of Trump’s reckless + botched covid response.   But Trump is holding economic aid hostage until after the election. This means individuals families small businesses and schools will suffer.  It is unconscionable.  https://t.co/o64flLux7O

“Vermont businesses needed help in May and they need it even more today.”  Last week Peter voted in favor of the updated #HEROESAct. The Senate has failed to act on robust COVID-19 relief for months but Vermonters + small businesses need relief now.   https://t.co/qaHUrPofEl

Independent music venues are hurting b/c of Covid.   According to @nivassoc 90% of its members may have to close their doors w/o government assistance. We need the #SaveOurStages Act now!  Venues have already closed. Let's not allow anymore to close. https://t.co/iMasSBI3p4

“Please you’ve done so well don’t let your guard down.”   This week Dr. Anthony Fauci said he wishes he “could bottle” Vermont’s COVID-19 response and implement it all over the US.   Keep it up Vermonters!   https://t.co/q29QgnokcK

Labor union workers built modern America served on the front line of this pandemic and will rebuild our communities in the aftermath of COVID-19.  This #LaborDay let’s recognize the good work being done by VT’s unions and all our essential workers. Thank you!

📣VT Farmers: There are still grants available for COVID-19 relief but the 10/1 deadline is approaching!  Many of our farmers have been hit hard by this crisis & need some help getting back on their feet. If that's you we encourage you to apply below!  https://t.co/334Oxo0lz6

The President's ineptitude and refusal to seriously address the coronavirus pandemic has already resulted in over 134k American deaths. This is unacceptable. When will the President wake up? We need a comprehensive federal plan NOW to slow the spread of Covid-19.

Yesterday I voted in support of the #MovingForward Act the House infrastructure package that would create millions of much needed jobs. It's past time for us to invest in modern climate resilient infrastructure and address the inequities exposed by the Covid-19 pandemic.
We're all in this together.   Visit my website for Coronavirus information and resources.  https://t.co/syYNt3NXZI
